company.name: cdnjs
company.headline: The #1 free and open source CDN built to make life easier for developers.

points: Working with [Cloudflare](https://cloudflare.com/) to resolve issues on the CDN as well as securing new sponsorships with companies such as [Atlassian Statuspage](https://statuspage.io/) for our new [status page](https://status.cdnjs.com/)

Managing the [cdnjs Twitter account](https://twitter.com/cdnjs) (and [status account](https://twitter.com/cdnjsStatus)), providing support to those who ask questions and triaging issues to be passed onto the maintainers.

Working with the cdnjs team to build [new documentation](https://github.com/cdnjs/new-docs), [updated branding](https://github.com/cdnjs/brand) and an active community around the service through our [GitHub organisation](https://github.com/cdnjs/cdnjs), [Discourse community](https://cdnjs.discourse.group/) and [Twitter following](https://twitter.com/cdnjs).

Creating and moderating our [Discourse forum](https://cdnjs.discourse.group/) to allow the community to interact with each other, get help on development issues, suggest improvements to the service and to meet the cdnjs team.

company.name: js.org
company.headline: JS.ORG - Dedicated to JavaScript and its awesome community since 2015.

points: Directly responsible for reviewing all pull requests made by third-party developers requesting their custom js.org subdomains on the [js.org GitHub repository](https://github.com/js-org/js.org).
Working with the js.org team and external contributors to develop new PR review and management systems through continuous integration (CI).
Handling the annual cleanup of the js.org active file to ensure all subdomains are valid, liaising with contributors on subdomains which have failed checks to resolve any issues.

company.name: JetBrains Community
company.headline: JetBrains Community is the unofficial community for all things JetBrains.

points: Working with the team at JetBrains to create [unique branding](https://github.com/JetBrains-Community/brand) for the community and to ensure that our operations align with what they expect of a user group.

Creating and manging a large [Discord server](https://discord.gg/dJK27sh) where the community is based as well as developing a [custom Discord bot](https://github.com/JetBrains-Community/discord) to provide dedicated JetBrains information for users.

Continually expanding the reach of the community not only on Discord but also through the expanding network of [JetBrains Community subreddits](https://www.reddit.com/user/SupremeDesigner/m/jetbrains_community/).

Running the [community Twitter account](https://twitter.com/jetbrainscomm) to provide key JetBrains updates to followers whilst also working to promote and build the community around JetBrains. Sharing interesting information and links to our community locations online.
